page.title: 05Marston, Moat Farm
page.content: This is perhaps the most noteworthy building in Marston.It is a cruck- framed farmhouse completely enclosed by a moat. The Snagge family lived here from 1562 - 1712.Thomas Snagge was the M.P.for Bedford and the speaker of the House of Commons in the reign of Elizabeth 1.His son was M.P. for Bedford County in 1588 and High Sheriff in 1607.The house declined in fortune in the 18th century but was bought by the Duke of Bedford in 1858 and 'modernised'as a farmhouse in 1880.It survives today as one of the best examples of a moated farmhouse and has recently been restored and converted into a restaurant which opened in August 1985.It seats 40 downstairs and 20 - 25 upstairs and is run by the proprietor,2 chefs and an apprentice and 14 staff.Food is in English style.
